model

Class SimpleSentence

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.SimpleSentence
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Clause, PCExpression, Unifiable

    public class SimpleSentence
extends Object
implements Unifiable, Clause
    This class represents predicates. It implements Unifiable and Clause.
    Author:
    Alexandre Camus

    • Method Detail

      • getSolver

        public AbstractSolutionNode getSolver(RuleSet rules,
                             SubstitutionSet parentSolution)
        Creates a solver which is a node in the tree proof. This is the version for the simple sentence.

        This function is recursive over all objects that can be proved and creates the tree of proof for a clause.

        Specified by:
        getSolver in interface Clause
        Parameters:
        rules - the RuleSet object containing the rules of knowledge.
        parentSolution - the solution known so far at the parent node.
        Returns:
        the node of the tree of proof.
        See Also:
        Clause.getSolver(RuleSet, SubstitutionSet)

      • length

        public int length()
        Gets the length which is the number of parameters plus the name of the simple sentence. It counts the number of Constant and Variable objects used to represent the simple sentence.
        Returns:
        the number of parameters plus the name of the simple sentence.

      • getTerm

        public Unifiable getTerm(int index)
        Gets the term at the specified index. The index is the position of the parameter.
        Parameters:
        index - the position of the parameter.
        Returns:
        the parameter at the specified position.

      • setTerms

        private void setTerms(Unifiable... terms)
        Sets the terms to the new specified terms. The old terms and their number will be erase by this update. Terms can be specified as an array or as independent inputs.
        Parameters:
        terms - the new terms of the simple sentence. It can be an array or independent inputs, one for each new term.

      • getName

        public String getName()
        Gets the name of the simple sentence. It is the name of the predicate or the functor.
        Specified by:
        getName in interface Unifiable
        Returns:
        the name of the simple sentence.
        See Also:
        Unifiable.getName()

      • replaceVariables

        public SimpleSentence replaceVariables(SubstitutionSet s)
        Replaces all the variables in the simple sentence according to the specified bindings.

        This method is recursive over all PCExpression implementations.

        Specified by:
        replaceVariables in interface PCExpression
        Parameters:
        s - the SubstitutionSet that contains the bindings of the variables so far.
        Returns:
        a SimpleSentence object representing the bound simple sentence.
        See Also:
        PCExpression.replaceVariables(model.SubstitutionSet)

      • standardizeVariablesApart

        public SimpleSentence standardizeVariablesApart(Hashtable<Variable,Variable> newVars)
        Standardizes the variables in order to be sure that there won't be any variable clashes.

        This method is recursive over all PCExpression implementations.

        Specified by:
        standardizeVariablesApart in interface PCExpression
        Parameters:
        newVars - is a parameter to save over the recursion all the variable replacements done so far.
        Returns:
        a SimpleSentence object representing the standardized simple sentence.
        See Also:
        PCExpression.standardizeVariablesApart(java.util.Hashtable)

      • unify

        public SubstitutionSet unify(Unifiable expr,
                    SubstitutionSet s)
        Unifies the simple sentence with the specified expr expression given the bindings s. This tries to get or add bindings in order to make logically equivalent the simple sentence and the specified expression.

        This method is recursive over all Unifiable implementations.

        Specified by:
        unify in interface Unifiable
        Parameters:
        expr - an expression to unify with the simple sentence.
        s - the SubstitutionSet object representing the bindings so far and/or the constraints applied.
        Returns:
        a SubstitutionSet object that contains all the bindings needed to unify the simple sentence to the specified expression.
        See Also:
        Unifiable.unify(Unifiable, SubstitutionSet)

      • equal

        public boolean equal(Unifiable expr,
            SubstitutionSet s)
        Checks if the simple sentence and the specified expr expression given the bindings s are equal. This tries to get bindings in order to make logically equivalent the simple sentence and the specified expression.

        This method is recursive over all Unifiable implementations.

        Specified by:
        equal in interface Unifiable
        Parameters:
        expr - an expression to unify with the expression.
        s - the SubstitutionSet object representing the bindings so far and/or the constraints applied.
        Returns:
        true if the specified bindings make logically equivalent the simple sentence and the specified one.
        See Also:
        Unifiable.equal(Unifiable, SubstitutionSet)

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Returns the simple sentence under the form of: "predicateName(parameter1, parameter2, ...)".
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        See Also:
        Object.toString()
